ingredients: [{"ingredients":"150g pack raw peeled king prawns"},{"ingredients":"1 ½ tbsp jerk seasoning"},{"ingredients":"400g can kidney beans in chilli sauce"},{"ingredients":"250g ready-cooked pouch coconut rice"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat 1 tbsp flavourless oil in a large frying pan. Add the prawns and the jerk seasoning, and cook for 1-2 mins. Drain the beans, reserving 3 tbsp of the chilli sauce."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the beans to the pan along with the reserved sauce and the coconut rice. Fry for 3-4 mins, then season with salt to taste and spoon into two bowls to serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 roasted red pepper (from a jar or roast one yourself)"},{"ingredients":"30ml olive oil"},{"ingredients":"50g walnuts , toasted, plus extra to serve"},{"ingredients":"1 small garlic clove"},{"ingredients":"100g linguine or spaghetti"},{"ingredients":"parmesan or vegetarian alternative, grated, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Blitz the roasted red pepper with the olive oil, walnuts and garlic in a food processor, season well and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Bring a pan of salted water to the boil, add the pasta and cook for 1 min less than the pack instructions and drain, reserving a ladleful of cooking water. Tip the pasta back into the pan, along with the reserved cooking water and red pepper sauce, and return to the heat to warm through. Tip the pasta into a bowl and top with the parmesan and some chopped toasted walnuts. Season and serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"half a leg of lamb (about 1.25kg/2lb 12oz)"},{"ingredients":"1kg onion (about 4 large ones)"},{"ingredients":"handful of thyme sprigs"},{"ingredients":"300ml red wine"},{"ingredients":"large handful parsley"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Firstly, prepare the lamb. Heat oven to 160C/fan140C/gas 3. Wipe the meat all over and season well. Heat 3 tbsp of olive oil in a large heavy flameproof casserole, add the meat and fry all over on a fairly high heat for about 8 mins, turning until it is evenly well browned. Remove to a plate."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Thinly slice the onions. Add to the pan and fry for about 10 mins, until softened and tinged with brown. Add a few of the thyme sprigs and cook for a further minute or so. Season with salt and pepper."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Sit the lamb on top of the onions, then add the wine. Cover tightly. Bake for 3 hrs. You can make to this stage up to 2 days in advance, then reheat for 45 mins."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"To finish off, strip the leaves from 2 thyme sprigs and chop them with the parsley. Scatter over before serving."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"70g hazelnuts , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"150g dark chocolate , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"500g block shop-bought puff pastry"},{"ingredients":"3 bananas , sliced"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp light brown soft sugar"},{"ingredients":"vanilla ice cream , to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Blitz 50g of the hazelnuts in a small food processor until they resemble fine breadcrumbs, then tip into a bowl with the chocolate."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Roll the pastry out to a round roughly 30cm in diameter on a sheet of baking parchment. Scatter the chocolate and hazelnut mixture over the pastry circle, leaving a 5cm border. Top with the bananas and most of the remaining hazelnuts, then fold the edges of the pastry over. Transfer the galette to a baking sheet along with the baking parchment, then chill in the fridge for at least 10 mins."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Remove from the fridge and sprinkle the sugar over the galette, then bake for 25-30 mins, or until golden and puffed up. Scatter over the remaining hazelnuts and serve with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, if you like."}]

recipe: Sausages with quick onion gravy & sweet potato chips
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2large orange  sweet potatoes about 800g/1¾lb total weight"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp vegetable oil"},{"ingredients":"8 plump  sausages"},{"ingredients":"365g jar onion  marmalade"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Preheat the oven to 200C/gas 6/fan 180C. Cut the sweet potatoes into wedges and put them in a large roasting tin. Drizzle over 2 tablespoons of the oil and toss the wedges to coat. Roast for 40-45 minutes until cooked through and crisp."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Halfway through the cooking time, heat the remaining oil in a frying pan. Add the sausages and cook for 20 minutes, turning regularly until cooked through."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Drain off any fat and add the onion marmalade, with about 100ml/31⁄2fl oz water. Stir well then heat through."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Sprinkle the chips with a little salt and serve with the sausages and gravy."}]

recipe: Smoked mackerel & leek hash with horseradish
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"250g new potatoes , halved"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp oil"},{"ingredients":"2 large leeks , thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"4 eggs"},{"ingredients":"100g peppered smoked mackerel , skin removed"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp creamed horseradish"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the potatoes in a microwaveable bowl with a splash of water, cover, then cook on high for 5 mins until tender (or steam or simmer them)."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, heat the oil in a frying pan over a medium heat, add the leeks with a pinch of salt and cook for 10 mins, stirring so they don’t stick, until softened. Tip in the potatoes, turn up the heat and fry for a couple of mins to crisp them up a bit. Flake through the mackerel."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Make four indents in the leek mixture in the pan, crack an egg into each, season, then cover the pan and cook for 6-8 mins until the whites have set and the yolks are runny. Serve the horseradish on the side, with the pan in the middle of the table."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tbsp Madras curry paste"},{"ingredients":"1 large butternut squash  (600g/1lb 5oz peeled weight), chopped into medium size chunks"},{"ingredients":"1 red pepper , halved, deseeded and roughly chopped into chunks"},{"ingredients":"400g can reduced-fat coconut milk"},{"ingredients":"small bunch  coriander , roughly chopped"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat a large frying pan or wok, tip in the curry paste and fry for 1 min. Add the squash and red pepper, then toss well in the paste."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour in the coconut milk with 200ml water and bring to a simmer. Cook for 15-20 mins or until the butternut squash is very tender and the sauce has thickened. Season to taste, then serve scattered with chopped coriander and naan bread or rice."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 cauliflower"},{"ingredients":"1½ tbsp oil"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp fennel seeds"},{"ingredients":"150g red lentils"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp curry paste of your choice"},{"ingredients":"½  lemon , juiced"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Remove the outer leaves from the cauliflower, cut off the stalk and roughly chop, then cut the head into small florets. Toss a quarter of the florets in 1 tbsp oil and 1 tsp of the fennel seeds, season well, then tip into a roasting tin and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat oven to 220C/200C fan/gas 7. Heat ½ tbsp oil in a saucepan over a medium heat and add the remaining fennel seeds, toast for 2 mins, then add the lentils and the remaining cauliflower. Stir in the curry paste, then add 1 litre water and bring to the boil. Simmer for 25 mins until the cauliflower is tender and the lentils are cooked through."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Meanwhile, put the roasting tin of cauliflower in the oven and cook for 20 mins until crisp and slightly charred. Tip the soup mixture into a food processor and blitz until smooth, tip back into the pan to warm through, adding the lemon juice and a little water if it’s too thick. Tip into bowls and top with the crispy cauliflower and fennel seeds to serve."}]

recipe: Beetroot, hummus & crispy chickpea sub sandwich
name: Beetroot, hummus & crispy chickpea sub sandwich

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"4 minute steaks  (Sainsbury's Taste the Difference are good) or 2 x 1cm thick sirloin steaks"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp  olive oil , plus extra for drizzling"},{"ingredients":"1 small  ciabatta  loaf"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp caramelised onions"},{"ingredients":"half an 85g bag  watercress"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the grill on. Heat a little oil in a frying pan. Season both sides of the steaks with salt, then fry for 1-2 minutes on each side. Meanwhile, slice the ciabatta in half lengthways and grill the cut sides until golden."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Drizzle the toasted ciabatta with olive oil, spread the bottom half with the onions and sit the steaks on top. Cover with the watercress and close the sandwich with the other half of the ciabatta. Cut into four sandwiches and serve two per person. Serve hot."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 sweet potatoes , about 300g/10oz each"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"200g chestnut mushroom , halved"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp chopped fresh rosemary  or ½ tsp dried"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp freshly grated parmesan , (or vegetarian alternative)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/fan 180C/gas 6. Prick the potatoes several times with a fork, then microwave on High for 8-10 mins, turning once, until tender. Meanwhile, heat the oil in a non-stick pan, add the mushrooms and rosemary and cook over a fairly high heat, stirring, until the mushrooms are tender and lightly coloured. Season to taste."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Put the potatoes in the oven and roast for 15 mins until the skins start to crisp. Split open and spoon over the mushrooms. Sprinkle with Parmesan to serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 salmon fillets"},{"ingredients":"1 large grapefruit"},{"ingredients":"100g bag watercress"},{"ingredients":"½ pack feta"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/ gas 6 and roast the salmon for 8 mins. Meanwhile, segment the grapefruit and mix the juices with 2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil to make a dressing."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Toss the watercress with the grapefruit segments, dressing and feta, and serve with the salmon, flaked into large pieces."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"50g bundle of rice noodles  (we used Sharwood's Thai stir-fry noodles)"},{"ingredients":"100g sugar snap peas , halved lengthways"},{"ingredients":"1 small red pepper , seeded and thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"handful fresh basil"},{"ingredients":"2 cooked chicken breasts"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"finely grated zest and juice of ½ lemon"},{"ingredients":"1 heaped tbsp mayonnaise"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Soak the noodles: Boil the kettle and tip the rice noodles into a heatproof bowl. Pour over boiling water to cover. Leave noodles to soak for 4 minutes."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Whisk and toss: Meanwhile, make the dressing. Whisk together the olive oil, lemon zest and juice and mayonnaise, then season if you want to. Drain the noodles and return to the bowl. Throw in the sugar snaps, red pepper and basil. Pour in half the dressing and gently toss."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"To serve: Divide the noodles between two bowls. Slice the chicken breasts and arrange on top of the noodles. Drizzle over the remaining dressing and serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"200g cooking chorizo"},{"ingredients":"2 x 400g cans chopped tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"2 x 400g cans drained butter beans"},{"ingredients":"1 tub fresh pesto"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Slice the chorizo and tip into a large saucepan over a medium heat. Fry gently for 5 mins or until starting to turn dark brown. Add the tomatoes and butter beans, bring to the boil, then simmer for 10 mins. Swirl through the pesto, season lightly and ladle into four bowls."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"3 large white potatoes"},{"ingredients":"olive oil , for frying"},{"ingredients":"4 pork sausages"},{"ingredients":"200g cherry tomatoes on the vine"},{"ingredients":"½ tub fresh pesto"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Peel and quarter the potatoes, then cook in a large pan of salted, boiling water for 15 mins. Drain and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour a glug of olive oil into a large frying pan over a medium heat and cook the sausages for 15 mins. Add the tomatoes to the pan for the final 5 mins. Mash the potatoes well and mix in the pesto. Season and serve with the sausages and tomatoes."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"500g lamb neck fillets, cut into bite-size pieces"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp paprika"},{"ingredients":"3 tsp ground cinnamon"},{"ingredients":"2 x 400g/14oz cans chopped tomato with olive oil and garlic"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp finely chopped parsley, plus extra to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat a large, non-stick frying pan. Cook the lamb well on all sides without adding extra oil. Tip in the spices, then fry for 1 min more until aromatic."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour in the chopped tomatoes and parsley, bring to the boil, then simmer gently, with a lid on, for 30 mins or until the lamb is tender. Serve sprinkled with more parsley."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"400g pasta  shapes"},{"ingredients":"6 good-quality sausages"},{"ingredients":"140g sun-dried tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp oil  from the sun-dried tomato jar"},{"ingredients":"a generous handful of fresh parsley , coarsely chopped"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Cook the pasta in boiling salted water according to the packet instructions or until tender."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Peel the skins off the sausages and chop the sausage meat into small hazelnut-sized pieces. Chop the sun-dried tomatoes into small chunks. Heat a tablespoon of the sun-dried tomato oil in a large frying pan (big enough to take the pasta later) and sizzle the sausage pieces for 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they’re crumbly and golden. Stir in the sun-dried tomato chunks and the remaining oil, and heat everything through."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"When the pasta is ready, drain it well and toss into the sausage mixture with the parsley. Make sure everything is well mixed and coated with the oil. Season generously with salt and pepper, and serve straight from the pan."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp rapeseed oil"},{"ingredients":"2 red onions , thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"300g kale"},{"ingredients":"300g wholemeal  pasta (penne or mafalda work well)"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp reduced-fat cream cheese"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp fresh pesto or vegetarian alternative"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large pan over a medium heat. Fry the onions for 10 mins until softened and beginning to caramelise. Add the kale and 100ml water, then cover and cook for 5 mins more, or until the kale has wilted."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Cook the pasta following pack instructions. Drain, reserving a little of the cooking water. Toss the pasta with the onion mixture, cream cheese and pesto, adding a splash of the reserved cooking water to loosen, if needed. Season."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"3 tbsp extra virgin olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp sherry vinegar"},{"ingredients":"4 peaches"},{"ingredients":"100g watercress"},{"ingredients":"50g smoked duck"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"In a large bowl, mix together 3 tbsp extra virgin olive oil and 1 tbsp sherry vinegar with some seasoning."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Cut 4 peaches into quarters and griddle for 2-3 mins each side until charred and slightly caramelised. Toss 100g watercress with the dressing, then divide between bowls. Top with the peaches and 50g smoked duck."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"250g strong cheddar , grated"},{"ingredients":"4 tomatoes , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 green or red chilli , deseeded and finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"½ large bunch coriander , leaves roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"8 flour tortillas (we used Discovery)"},{"ingredients":"oil , for brushing"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the cheese, tomatoes, chilli and coriander leaves into a bowl with some seasoning, then mix well."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Warm tortillas in the microwave according to pack instructions – this makes them more bendable. Divide the cheese mix over one half of each tortilla. Fold over the other half to make 8 half-moons, then press down to seal."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Brush the tops with a little oil, then sit, oil-side down, on a hot area of the barbecue. Cook for a couple of mins until crisp and golden, brush the uncooked side with oil, then flip over for another few mins. Slice into wedges, then pile onto a platter while you cook the rest."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"4 chicken breasts"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"250g cherry tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp pesto"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the chicken breasts in a large, shallow roasting tray and drizzle with olive oil. Grill for 10 mins, then add cherry tomatoes and grill for another 5 mins until chicken is cooked. Drizzle pesto over the top and serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"125g ball mozzarella, torn into small pieces"},{"ingredients":"50g strong cheddar, grated"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp wholegrain mustard"},{"ingredients":"4 skinless boneless chicken breast fillets"},{"ingredients":"8 smoked streaky bacon rashers"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/fan 180C/gas 6. Mix the cheeses and mustard together. Cut a slit into the side of each chicken breast, then stuff with the mustard mixture. Wrap each stuffed chicken breast with 2 bacon rashers – not too tightly, but enough to hold the chicken together. Season, place on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 mins."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"3 tbsp Thai green curry paste"},{"ingredients":"400ml can coconut milk"},{"ingredients":"150g cooked prawns"},{"ingredients":"250g pack courgetti"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat 1 tsp flavourless oil in a frying pan over a medium heat. Add the curry paste and cook for 1 min. Pour in the coconut milk, then leave to bubble away for a few mins before adding the prawns and courgetti. Cook for 1 min more to warm through, then divide between bowls."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 thick slices of white bread"},{"ingredients":"wedge of camembert  or brie (about 85g/3oz)"},{"ingredients":"a spoonful of cranberry  sauce"},{"ingredients":"a few drops of balsamic vinegar"},{"ingredients":"butter"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Butter the bread. Put a wedge of camembert or brie on the unbuttered side of one slice of bread. Top with a spoonful of cranberry sauce. Drizzle with a few drops of balsamic vinegar, if you have some."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Put the second slice of bread on top, buttered side out. Fry in a hot non-stick pan, pressing down with a fish slice, for a minute or two on each side, until golden brown and melting. Cut in half and eat straightaway."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"3 large leeks"},{"ingredients":"150g pack raw peeled king prawns"},{"ingredients":"5 large eggs"},{"ingredients":"120g garlic & herb cream cheese"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a medium frying pan. Slice the leeks and add to the pan, cooking for 5 mins. Add the prawns and cook for 1 min more. Beat the eggs and whisk through half the cream cheese. Season to taste. Pour the mixture over the prawns and leeks, dot over the remaining cheese and cook on a medium heat for 5-8 mins. Finish under a medium-hot grill for 2 mins until just set with a slight wobble."}]

recipe: Beetroot, hummus & crispy chickpea sub sandwich
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"300g pack  cooked beetroot in water, drained, half sliced"},{"ingredients":"400g can chickpeas , drained"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp vegan pesto"},{"ingredients":"olive oil"},{"ingredients":"splash of vinegar (white wine vinegar if you have it)"},{"ingredients":"2 large ciabatta rolls, sliced in half"},{"ingredients":"2 large handfuls mixed rocket, watercress & spinach  salad"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Blitz the whole beetroot, ¾ of the chickpeas, 2 tbsp pesto and 1 tbsp oil in a food processor with some seasoning until you have a thick, smooth hummus. Heat the ciabatta following the pack instructions."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Fry the remaining chickpeas in a little oil until crisp, then set aside. Toss the salad leaves with the remaining pesto and a splash of vinegar. Slice the rolls, then assemble the sandwiches with the hummus, beetroot slices, salad leaves and fried chickpeas."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"4 slices of Parma ham"},{"ingredients":"½ small pack basil"},{"ingredients":"350g tomato and mascarpone sauce"},{"ingredients":"250g pack courgetti"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Roughly tear the ham and basil. Heat a frying pan over a medium heat and dry-fry the ham until crisp. Transfer to a plate with a slotted spoon. Add the sauce to the pan and cook for 1-2 mins, then toss in the courgetti. Cook for 1 min more until warmed through. Divide between bowls, then top with the ham and basil."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"4 salmon fillets"},{"ingredients":"sunflower oil , or any oil suitable for frying"},{"ingredients":"1 fajita kit"},{"ingredients":"2 avocados"},{"ingredients":"2 limes"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Coat the salmon in 1 tbsp oil and the fajita spice mix. Add 1 tbsp oil to a frying pan and fry for 8 mins until blackened."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Mash the avocados with a fork, season and squeeze over the juice of 1 lime. Serve the salmon in large flakes with the tortillas, avocado, salsa and the other lime, cut into wedges."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"150g soba or wholemeal noodles (300g if using pre-cooked)"},{"ingredients":"25g toasted sesame seeds , plus extra to serve"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp soy sauce"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp oil"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp rice vinegar (or any white vinegar)"},{"ingredients":"200g spinach leaves"},{"ingredients":"2 seabass fillets"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Use a spice grinder or pestle and mortar to crush the sesame seeds, then stir in the soy sauce, oil, 1 tbsp of water and a splash of rice vinegar, to make a creamy dressing, season and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Bring a pan of salted water to the boil, add the noodles and cook following pack instructions, then drain and set aside. Using the same pan, tip in all the spinach and cook until reduced down and dark green. Tip in the noodles, along with the sesame dressing and a splash of water and toss well to heat through."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a non-stick frying pan over a medium to high heat. Season the skin of the seabass, then place in the pan skin-side down, fry until the skin has crisped up and the flesh has nearly all turned opaque, around 3 mins. Flip over and fry for 30 seconds further, until the fish is flaking and cooked through. Divide the noodles and greens between two bowls and place the fish on top. Scatter over the toasted sesame seeds and serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"8 small  leeks , white part only"},{"ingredients":"8 slices cooked ham"},{"ingredients":"100g cheddar , grated"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp Dijon mustard"},{"ingredients":"6 tbsp crème fraîche  (full or half-fat)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/fan180C/gas 6. Cook the leeks in a pan of boiling salted water for 4-5 mins or until just tender. Drain and cool under a cold tap to stop them from cooking any further, then drain again well and pat dry on kitchen paper."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Wrap each leek in a slice of ham, then arrange, side-by-side, in a large baking dish. Mix the cheddar in a bowl with the Dijon mustard and crème fraîche, until well combined. Season to taste. Spread over the leeks, then bake for 15-20 mins until bubbling and golden brown. Serve at once with plenty of crusty bread to mop up the juices."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 small or 1 large ciabatta"},{"ingredients":"150g pack cooking chorizo , halved lengthways"},{"ingredients":"75g pesto"},{"ingredients":"200g roasted red peppers from a jar"},{"ingredients":"handful rocket"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4 and put the ciabatta in to warm up. Put a griddle pan over a medium heat and cook the chorizo for 5 mins each side or until charred and cooked through."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Open up the warmed ciabatta and spread the pesto on the bottom. Layer with the red peppers , then the warm chorizo. Scatter over the rocket, sandwich the ciabatta together, cut in two and serve."}]

recipe: Smoked mackerel & leek hash with horseradish
name: Smoked mackerel & leek hash with horseradish

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 onion"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"knob of butter"},{"ingredients":"6 rashers streaky bacon, chopped"},{"ingredients":"300g risotto rice"},{"ingredients":"1l hot vegetable stock"},{"ingredients":"100g frozen peas"},{"ingredients":"freshly grated parmesan, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Finely chop 1 onion. Heat 2 tbsp olive oil and a knob of butter in a pan, add the onions and fry until lightly browned (about 7 minutes)."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add 6 chopped rashers streaky bacon and fry for a further 5 minutes, until it starts to crisp."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Add 300g risotto rice and 1l hot vegetable stock, and bring to the boil. Stir well, then reduce the heat and cook, covered, for 15-20 minutes until the rice is almost tender."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Stir in 100g frozen peas, add a little salt and pepper and cook for a further 3 minutes, until the peas are cooked."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Serve sprinkled with freshly grated parmesan and freshly ground black pepper."}]

recipe: Sausages with quick onion gravy & sweet potato chips
name: Sausages with quick onion gravy & sweet potato chips

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"5 tbsp salted butter , plus extra for the tin"},{"ingredients":"250g crunchy peanut butter"},{"ingredients":"8 tbsp strawberry or raspberry jam"},{"ingredients":"80g light brown soft  sugar"},{"ingredients":"200g rolled oats"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Butter and line the base and sides of a 20cm square cake tin with baking parchment."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Put 3 tbsp each of the peanut butter and jam in separate small bowls and set aside. Tip the remaining peanut butter, the rest of the jam and the butter and sugar into a pan set over a medium heat and stir until everything has melted together. Quickly stir in the oats, then leave to cool for 5 mins."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Spoon the mixture into the prepared cake tin and gently press down with your hands. Dot over the reserved peanut butter and jam, then bake for 20-25 mins or until golden brown. Leave to cool completely in the tin, then turn out onto a board and cut into squares."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"300g gnocchi"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp unsalted butter"},{"ingredients":"60g parmesan or vegetarian alternative, finely grated"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp black pepper"},{"ingredients":"salad leaves , to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Cook the gnocchi in a large pan of lightly salted, boiling water. Drain and reserve 200ml of the cooking water."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat the butter in a large frying pan. Add the gnocchi, cheese and pepper as well as 150ml of the cooking water, raise the heat a little and stir vigorously until melted and the gnocchi is well coated. Pour in more of the reserved water if you like it saucier. Season with a little salt. Transfer the gnocchi to bowls and serve with a mixed salad, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"8 chicken thighs , skin on"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp seasoned flour"},{"ingredients":"1 head garlic"},{"ingredients":"3 large stalks rosemary"},{"ingredients":"300ml dry white wine"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Prepare the chicken: Wipe the chicken with kitchen paper, trim away any excess skin with scissors then toss the thighs in the seasoned flour. Separate the bulb of garlic into cloves (no need to peel)."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Fry the chicken: Heat 2 tbsp of olive oil in a large pan until searingly hot, add the chicken, skin side down, and fry without moving the chicken until the skin is crisp and browned. Turn the chicken over and brown it on all sides (you may need to do this in batches). Add the garlic and rosemary, then pour in the wine and season with salt and pepper. Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat and simmer, covered, for 40-45 minutes, until the chicken is tender and the sauce thickened. Serve with rice or parsley-tossed tagliatelle, and buttered spinach."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 chicken breasts"},{"ingredients":"320g sheet all butter puff pastry"},{"ingredients":"150g Boursin or garlic & herb cream cheese"},{"ingredients":"½ lemon , zested and cut into wedges to serve"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil , plus extra for brushing"},{"ingredients":"200g mixed pack green beans and broccoli"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 220C/200C Fan/gas 7. Cut a slit halfway in each chicken breast, then put each one between two pieces of baking parchment and bash with a rolling pin to flatten slightly."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Cut your sheet of pastry in half widthways and put both halves on a baking tray. Sit a chicken breast on top of each half, then cram the cavities with the Boursin (don’t worry if a bit of cheese oozes out). Season, scatter over the lemon zest then fold the edges of the pastry in to the centre and pinch shut. Flip each parcel over so the seal is on the bottom. Brush with a little oil, then bake for 30 mins until deep golden."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"About 10 mins before your parcels are ready, steam or boil the greens until tender. Toss in the oil and season. Serve alongside your chicken parcels with lemon wedges for squeezing over."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1.2kg spinach"},{"ingredients":"15g butter"},{"ingredients":"6 lightly smoked raw salmon fillets, skin removed (about 140g each)"},{"ingredients":"300ml double cream"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the spinach in a really big saucepan (or two saucepans) and add a few tablespoons of water. Cover, set over a medium heat and cook for about 5-8 mins, turning the spinach over every so often, until wilted. Tip it into a colander to drain and allow it to cool (spread it out on a plate to cool it quicker). Take big handfuls of it in your fists and squeeze out the excess water. It’s really important that you do this, otherwise the water will leach out and make the cream watery and green."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Chop the spinach. Melt the butter in a saucepan and gently toss the spinach in it. Season with pepper and a tiny bit of salt (there’s so much salt in the salmon). Heat the oven to 160C/140C fan/gas 3. Lay the spinach in the bottom of a gratin dish (about 30cm x 20cm), then arrange the salmon fillets on top."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Heat the double cream in a small pan, then pour it all over the salmon and spinach. Bake for 35 mins, or until the top is golden and the cream is bubbling."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1  bunch asparagus"},{"ingredients":"142ml tub double cream"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves , peeled, but left whole"},{"ingredients":"50g parmesan , half grated, half shaved"},{"ingredients":"250g tagliatelle"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"To prepare the asparagus, cut off and discard the woody ends, then neatly cut the tips away from the stalks. Keep the tips and stalks separate. In a small saucepan bring the cream and garlic to the boil. Take off the heat, remove the garlic, then set the pan aside."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Cook the stalks in boiling salted water for about 4-5 mins until tender, drain, then tip into the cream with the grated parmesan. Blitz with a hand blender until smooth."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Cook the pasta according to pack instructions, then throw in the tips 2 mins before the end of cooking time. Gently reheat the cream, drain pasta, then tip into a bowl with the cream. Toss, divide into pasta bowls, top with parmesan shavings and serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 x 400g cans  cherry tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"400g can mixed bean salad , drained"},{"ingredients":"200g baby spinach"},{"ingredients":"4 medium eggs"},{"ingredients":"50g thinly sliced smoked ham , torn"},{"ingredients":"wholemeal rye bread , to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Tip the tomatoes and bean salad into an ovenproof frying pan or shallow flameproof casserole dish. Simmer for 10 mins, or until reduced. Stir in the spinach and cook for 5 mins more until wilted."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat the grill to medium. Make four indentations in the mixture using the back of a spoon, then crack one egg in each. Nestle the ham in the mixture, then grill for 4-5 mins, or until the whites are set and the yolks runny. Serve with rye bread, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"200g penne"},{"ingredients":"2 skinless salmon fillets"},{"ingredients":"60g sundried tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"80g bag spinach"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Cook the pasta following pack instructions. Fry the salmon for 4-6 mins with the tomatoes in their oil. Flake the fish in the pan, then add the drained pasta and the spinach. Stir for 1-2 mins until the spinach is wilted and everything is coated."}]

recipe: Mary Cadogan’s salmon with a cheesy crunch crust
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"x salmon fillets"},{"ingredients":"50g softened butter"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp slivered or flaked almond"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp chopped fresh parsley"},{"ingredients":"50g gruyère  or emmental, coarsely grated"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Preheat the oven to 190C/fan 170C/gas 5. Season the salmon steaks all over. Liberally butter a shallow ovenproof dish big enough to take the fish in one layer. Smear the salmon with the remaining butter."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Mix the almonds, parsley and the gruyère or emmental, then press on to the top of the steaks."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Bake for 15-20 minutes, until the topping is crisp and golden and the salmon cooked. Serve with potatoes and a green salad or broccoli."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp oil"},{"ingredients":"200g chorizo, peeled and chopped"},{"ingredients":"300g arborio risotto rice"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp vinegar (white wine vinegar if you have it)"},{"ingredients":"1.2l chicken stock (fresh is best), heated until simmering"},{"ingredients":"200g frozen peas"},{"ingredients":"60g parmesan, finely grated, plus extra to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large frying pan, tip in the chorizo and fry until it is crisp and all the oil has been released. Remove a quarter of the chorizo with a slotted spoon and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Tip the rice into the pan, stir to coat it in the oil and toast for a min or so, then pour in the vinegar. Once the vinegar has evaporated, add a ladleful of the stock, stir then, once absorbed, add a bit more. Continue doing this for about 20 mins until most of the stock has been absorbed and the rice has swollen but still has a slight bite."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Tip in the peas, parmesan and the remaining stock. Give everything a good stir. Once the cheese has melted, season with black pepper, then divide between bowls, topping each portion with the remaining crisp chorizo and extra grated parmesan."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"handful button or chestnut mushrooms, sliced"},{"ingredients":"25g vegetarian cheddar, grated"},{"ingredients":"small handful parsley leaves, roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 eggs, beaten"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the olive oil in a small non-stick frying pan. Tip in the mushrooms and fry over a high heat, stirring occasionally for 2-3 mins until golden. Lift out of the pan into a bowl and mix with the cheese and parsley."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Place the pan back on the heat and swirl the eggs into it. Cook for 1 min or until set to your liking, swirling with a fork now and again."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Spoon the mushroom mix over one half of the omelette. Using a spatula or palette knife, flip the omelette over to cover the mushrooms. Cook for a few moments more, lift onto a plate and serve with oven chips and salad."}]

recipe: Mary Cadogan’s salmon with a cheesy crunch crust
name: Mary Cadogan's salmon with a cheesy crunch crust

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"4 large plaice  fillets, about 140g/5oz each"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves , thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"2 leeks , washed, trimmed and shredded into very thin strips"},{"ingredients":"1 lemon , plus wedges to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Get grilling: Preheat the grill to High. Lay the plaice fillets, skin-side down, on an oiled baking sheet, season with salt and freshly ground black pepper and drizzle with 1 tbsp of the oil. Grill the fish for 2-3 minutes (no need to turn)."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Make the vinaigrette: While the plaice is grilling, heat the remaining oil in a small frying pan. Add the garlic and leeks and fry over a gentle heat until soft and golden. Squeeze in the juice from the lemon, then take the pan off the heat. Remove the fish from under the grill and arrange on plates. Using a slotted spoon, top the fish with the garlic and leeks. Heat the vinaigrette for a further minute until piping hot, then pour it over the fish and finish with a good grinding of black pepper. Serve with lemon wedges and boiled new potatoes."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp rapeseed oil"},{"ingredients":"70g mixed mushrooms , sliced"},{"ingredients":"50g smoked tofu , cut into small cubes"},{"ingredients":"½ tbsp  brown rice miso paste"},{"ingredients":"50g dried buckwheat or egg noodles"},{"ingredients":"2 spring onions , shredded"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat half the oil in a frying pan over a medium heat. Add the mushrooms and fry for 5-6 mins, or until golden. Transfer to a bowl using a slotted spoon and set aside. Add the remaining oil to the pan and fry the tofu for 3-4 mins, or until evenly golden."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Mix the miso paste with 325ml boiling water in a jug. Cook the noodles following pack instructions, then drain and transfer to a bowl. Top with the mushrooms and tofu, then pour over the miso broth. Scatter over the spring onions just before serving."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"2 x 400g packs ready-roasted potatoes  (available with different flavourings from most supermarkets)"},{"ingredients":"8 eggs , beaten"},{"ingredients":"4 vine-ripened tomatoes , sliced"},{"ingredients":"150g ball mozzarella , torn into pieces"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Start by frying: Heat the oil in a large frying pan. Empty the potatoes into the pan, spread them out to cover the base, then fry for 5 minutes. Pour in the beaten eggs so they completely cover the potatoes, season well and leave the tortilla to cook on a medium heat for about 15-20 minutes, or until the base and edges have set."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Grill to finish: Take the tortilla off the hob and place under a hot grill until the top is firm, then remove from the grill and scatter over the tomatoes and mozzarella. Put the tortilla back under the grill for a further 3-5 minutes, or until the tomatoes are soft and the cheese has melted. To serve, cut into thick wedges."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"olive oil , for frying"},{"ingredients":"200g risotto rice"},{"ingredients":"700ml chicken stock or vegetable stock"},{"ingredients":"1 tub fresh pesto"},{"ingredients":"100g soft goat's cheese"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Pour a glug of olive oil into a large saucepan. Tip in the rice and fry for 1 min. Add half the stock and cook until absorbed. Add the remaining stock, a ladle at a time, and cook until the rice is al dente, stirring continually, for 20-25 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Stir through the pesto and half the goat’s cheese. Serve topped with the remaining cheese."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"200g bag spinach leaves"},{"ingredients":"175g jar sundried tomato in oil"},{"ingredients":"100g feta cheese, crumbled"},{"ingredients":"2 eggs"},{"ingredients":"125g filo pastry"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the spinach into a large pan. Pour over a couple tbsp water, then cook until just wilted. Tip into a sieve, leave to cool a little, then squeeze out any excess water and roughly chop. Roughly chop the tomatoes and put into a bowl along with the spinach, feta and eggs. Mix well."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Carefully unroll the filo pastry. Cover with some damp sheets of kitchen paper to stop it drying out. Take a sheet of pastry and brush liberally with some of the sundried tomato oil. Drape oil-side down in a 22cm loosebottomed cake tin so that some of the pastry hangs over the side. Brush oil on another piece of pastry and place in the tin, just a little further round. Keep placing the pastry pieces in the tin until you have roughly three layers, then spoon over the filling. Pull the sides into the middle, scrunch up and make sure the filling is covered. Brush with a little more oil."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Heat oven to 180C/fan 160C/gas 4. Cook the pie for 30 mins until the pastry is crisp and golden brown. Remove from the cake tin, slice into wedges and serve with salad."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"200g blanched almonds"},{"ingredients":"50ml extra virgin olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 garlic clove (if you like garlic, try with 1 1/2 cloves, but children may find it too strong)"},{"ingredients":"1 ½ tbsp red wine vinegar"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Blend the ingredients together with 350ml water and 1 tsp salt."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Let the soup cool in the fridge for 1 hr or so, then serve with a drizzle of oil and some black pepper."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"500g new potatoes"},{"ingredients":"200g pack smoked salmon"},{"ingredients":"8 large eggs"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp chopped dill"},{"ingredients":"100g frozen petits pois"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Thickly slice the potatoes and cook in a pan of boiling salted water until just tender, about 10 minutes. Drain well and leave to cool slightly."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Cut the salmon into wide strips. Crack the eggs into a bowl, beat with a fork until lightly foamy, then stir in the smoked salmon, dill, peas and plenty of salt and pepper. Finally, stir in the potatoes."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Heat 3 tablespoons of olive oil in a large non-stick frying pan, carefully pour in the egg mixture and cook over a fairly low heat for 10-15 minutes, until the egg is starting to set just under the surface."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Put a plate that is slightly larger than the top of the pan on top and invert the frittata onto it. Slide it back into the pan and cook for a further 5 minutes to brown the underside. Slide on to a plate and leave to cool for 5 minutes before cutting into wedges. A tomato and chive salad tastes very fresh with this."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"400g pack oven-roasted vegetables"},{"ingredients":"1 can kidney beans in chilli sauce"},{"ingredients":"1 can chopped tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"1 ready-to-eat mixed grain pouch"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/ gas 6. Cook the vegetables in a casserole dish for 15 mins. Tip in the beans and tomatoes, season, and cook for another 10-15 mins until piping hot. Heat the pouch in the microwave on High for 1 min and serve with the chilli."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"4 chunky skinless white fish  fillets, such as hoki or cod, about 500g/1lb 2oz total weight"},{"ingredients":"oil , for brushing"},{"ingredients":"4 thin slices of ham"},{"ingredients":"50g grated mature cheddar"},{"ingredients":"2 spring onions , sliced at an angle"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Preheat the grill to high and lightly oil a large shallow heatproof dish. Arrange the fillets in the dish, slightly spaced apart, and brush them with a little oil. Grill for 2 minutes."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Remove the dish from the grill, turn the fish over and top each fillet with a scrunched slice of ham. Mix together the cheese and onions, scatter over the fish and season with salt and pepper. Return to the grill for 5 minutes until the fish flakes easily when prodded with a knife. Serve with green vegetables – broccoli or stir-fried cabbage would be good."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"750g bag  frozen potato wedges"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"2 pieces sirloin steak , about 350g/12oz in total"},{"ingredients":"120g bag  herb salad"},{"ingredients":"6 tbsp honey and mustard  salad dressing , bought or homemade"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Cook the potatoes: Scatter the frozen wedges in a single layer on a large baking sheet and bake until golden and crunchy, according to packet instructions."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Cook the steaks: While the potatoes are in the oven, heat the oil in a frying pan until hot, and fry the steaks for 2-3 minutes on each side. Remove the steaks from the pan and leave to rest for a few minutes before slicing into thin strips."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Assemble the dish: When the potatoes are done, sprinkle them with a little salt and black pepper. Tip the salad leaves into a bowl and toss with 4 tablespoons of the dressing. Divide the salad between 4 plates, top with potatoes and then the steak. Drizzle over the remaining dressing and serve immediately."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"700g cubed lamb"},{"ingredients":"400g can tomatoes  in rich juice"},{"ingredients":"2-3 tsp  harissa paste"},{"ingredients":"410g can chickpeas , drained"},{"ingredients":"handful fresh  coriander"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Rinse the lamb and pat dry with kitchen paper. Tip into a large pan and add tomatoes. Half fill the tomato can with water and add to the pan with the harissa paste and a good sprinkling of salt and pepper."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Bring the liquid to the boil, then reduce the heat, cover and simmer for 1-11⁄4 hours, until the lamb is tender. Rinse the chickpeas and add them to the pan, then simmer for a further 5 minutes."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Taste and add more seasoning if necessary. Roughly chop the coriander, then scatter over the dish. Serve with couscous or rice."}]
